sentences: Ta on elanud selles linnas aastaid.
context: The Estonian word 'aastaid' is the partitive case form of 'aasta', meaning 'year'. It indicates duration or length of time and translates to English expressions like 'for years', 'many years', or 'a long time'. This form is typically used with verbs that indicate duration, such as 'olen töötanud' (have worked), 'on olnud' (has been), or 'on elanud' (has lived).
